intro: Metrosideros waialealae var. fauriei, commonly known as the Haleakalā silversword, is a rare endemic plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and striking red flowers. The plant thrives in the high-altitude volcanic soils of Haleakalā National Park. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is critically endangered and protected under conservation efforts. Its unique adaptations to the harsh alpine environment make it an important species for ecological studies in Hawaii.
